item.title: Firebase integration with PHP
item.dc:creator: Avinash Dalvi
item.description:
Step to start : Create firebase account for web app    https://firebase.google.com/products/  as per this guideline create cloud storage and create your      Firebase account Then create service account for configuration json parameters     follow this installation guide  …

The post Firebase integration with PHP appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Step to start :
  1. Create firebase account for web app
   https://firebase.google.com/products/  as per this guideline create cloud storage and create your      Firebase account
  1. Then create service account for configuration json parameters
    follow this installation guide
    https://firebase-php.readthedocs.io/en/stable/setup.html#setup
    https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/OAuth2ServiceAccount
    
    Download JSON file name will like “api-project-1075484619737-3371fe5240c8.json”. Keep this file      this will use in step 3 while doing configuration in project
    
  1. Install firebase in your machine using composer
   https://firebase-php.readthedocs.io/en/stable/overview.html#installation
   Note : PHP 7.X is recommend for this.
   then
   https://firebase-php.readthedocs.io/en/stable/overview.html#usage-example
  1. Installation complete! Enjoy. Next blog will cover fetching record from database.

The post Firebase integration with PHP appeared first on .

item.title: How to Dump/Print Doctrine entity in zf2?
item.dc:creator: Suraj Koli
item.description:
Here is the solutions: \Doctrine\Common\Util\Debug::dump($UserEntity);

The post How to Dump/Print Doctrine entity in zf2? appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Here is the solutions:

\Doctrine\Common\Util\Debug::dump($UserEntity);

item.title: The requested URL /phpmyadmin/index.php was not found on this server.
item.dc:creator: Suraj Koli
item.description:
Error: The requested URL /phpmyadmin/index.php was not found on this server. after upgrading php. Just run the below command on your terminal, which create symbolic link to your phpmyadmin directory. sudo ln -s /usr/share/phpmyadmin /var/www done..

The post The requested URL /phpmyadmin/index.php was not found on this server. appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Error:

The requested URL /phpmyadmin/index.php was not found on this server. after upgrading php.

Just run the below command on your terminal, which create symbolic link to your phpmyadmin directory.

sudo ln -s /usr/share/phpmyadmin /var/www

done..

The post The requested URL /phpmyadmin/index.php was not found on this server. appeared first on .

item.title: Include php packages in your project through php Composer
item.dc:creator: Suraj Koli
item.description:
Steps : 1) curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php. 2) php -r “readfile(‘https://getcomposer.org/installer’);” | php 3) create a composer.json {     “require”: {          “monolog/monolog”: “1.2.*”      } } 4) php composer.phar install 5) composer install 6) require “/vendor/autoload.php”; 7) use monolog/monolog;…

The post Include php packages in your project through php Composer appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Steps :

1) curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php.

2) php -r “readfile(‘https://getcomposer.org/installer’);” | php

3) create a composer.json

{    

“require”: {   

      “monolog/monolog”: “1.2.*” 

    }

}

4) php composer.phar install

5) composer install

6) require “/vendor/autoload.php”;

7) use monolog/monolog;

8) done..

Source : https://getcomposer.org/doc/00-intro.md

The post Include php packages in your project through php Composer appeared first on .
